qas.question: When was Olin Business School founded?
What was the original name of Olin Business School?

answers.text: the School of Commerce and Finance

qas.question: After whom is Olin Business School named?
When was Olin Business School named?
Where was an Executive MBA program established by Washington University in 2002?
When was John M. Olin born?
In what year was Fudan University established?
In what field was John M. Olin an entrepreneur in?
In what year did the Olin Business School start offering its MS in Finance degree?
In what year did John M. Olin die?

context: Founded as <a1_0>the School of Commerce and Finance<a1_0/> in <a0_0><b5_0><b6_0>1917<b6_0/><b5_0/><a0_0/>, the Olin Business School was named after entrepreneur <a2_0>John M. Olin<a2_0/> in <a3_0><b8_0><b9_0>1988<b9_0/><b8_0/><a3_0/>. The school's academic programs include BSBA, MBA, Professional MBA (PMBA), Executive MBA (EMBA), MS in Finance, MS in Supply Chain Management, MS in Customer Analytics, Master of <b7_0>Accounting<b7_0/>, Global Master of Finance Dual Degree program, and Doctorate programs, as well as non-degree executive education. In 2002, an Executive MBA program was established in <a4_0>Shanghai<a4_0/>, in cooperation with Fudan University.
